cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north then accelerate north-northeast across the northeast Gulf, cross the Florida Big Bend Thursday night, then move offshore the southeast U.S. coast toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (between Anclote River and Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL (Gulf coast). Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula and the U.S. east coast from northern Florida through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy conditions with a 20% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (34-kt) winds; strongest gusts expected Friday as the system passes north of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge (generally <2 ft) possible along the Atlantic beaches but significant surge not expected at Port Canaveral
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of very heavy rain Thursday night through Friday with 5â€“10 inches possible; localized flash flooding risk around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous surf for cruise and cargo operations; frequent squalls reducing visibility
